titleInfo.title: Letter to parents from James H. Neese, 1943 July 18

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: A two-page handwritten letter by James Neese to his parents, Mr. and Mrs. T.L. Neese, Jr. of Nashville, Tenn. James often wrote to his parents and brother in Nashville to tell them about his experiences in the Army infantry serving in Africa and Italy from 1943 to 1945. In this particular letter Neese writes on American Red Cross stationary. He talks about being in North Africa and relaxing by the beaches. He comments on the makeup of the population, stating it is mostly French, Jews, and Natives. He reports that the local children bother the soldiers for candy and gum quite often, tells of the nice beachside building they have taken over and transformed into their service club. Neese closes the letter by predicting the war will not last too much longer, and lastly asking for everyone to send mail. Includes envelope. Forms part of the Veterans History Project. 1 letter: col. ; 6 x 10 in.
